annotation.message: An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.

a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SMeningococcalMenCLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Meningococcal.Monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine schedule) * Schedule Table: Monovalent MenC conjugate schedule */ library IMMZD18SMeningococcalMenCLogic

def.name: First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines" and "Type of dose" = "Primary series") = 1

a:s.a:s: "One meningococcal primary series dose was administered"

expression.name: One meningococcal primary series dose was administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 1

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of the meningococcal dose 1

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: Child's birth

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date of birth"

a:s.a:s: "No meningococcal primary series dose was administered"
"First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered"

operand.name: No meningococcal primary series dose was administered
First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 1 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date of birth" + 2 months

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 1 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: For monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine, one single intramuscular dose is recommended for children aged ≥ 12 months, teenagers and adults. Children aged 2–11 months require 2 doses administered.

a:s.a:s: 'For monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine, one single intramuscular dose is recommended for children aged ≥ 12 months, teenagers and adults. Children aged 2–11 months require 2 doses administered.'

operand.value: For monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine, one single intramuscular dose is recommended for children aged ≥ 12 months, teenagers and adults. Children aged 2–11 months require 2 doses administered.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 1 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 1 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

def.name: Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines") = TRUE

a:s.a:s: "Two meningococcal primary series doses were administered"

expression.name: Two meningococcal primary series doses were administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 2

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of the meningococcal dose 2 for clients that start the series when aged ≤ 11 months

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines" and "Type of dose" = "Primary series") = 1 and "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines") - "Date of birth" ≤ 11 months

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered"
"Client's age was less than or equal to 11 months when the primary series was started"
"Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months"

operand.name: First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered
Client's age was less than or equal to 11 months when the primary series was started
Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 2 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines") + 2 months

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 2 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.

a:s.a:s: 'Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.'

operand.value: Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 2 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal dose 2 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

def.name: Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines" AND "Type of dose" = "Booster dose") = 1

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of the meningococcal booster dose for clients that start the series when aged ≤ 11 months

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines") = TRUE and "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines" and "Dose number" = 1) - "Date of birth" ≤ 11 months

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months"
"Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed"

operand.name: Second meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for clients that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months
Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Meningococcal vaccines") + 1 year

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.

a:s.a:s: 'Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.'

operand.value: Children 2–11 months require 2 doses administered at an interval of at least 2 months and a booster about 1 year after.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Meningococcal booster dose Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

a:t.name: test
a:t.value: Test expected results based on example patients

a:s.a:s: "First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered"
"Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed"

operand.name: First meningococcal dose from the primary series was administered
Meningococcal booster dose was administered for the client that started the series when client's age was less than or equal to 11 months. Immunization schedule has been completed
